newsitem.title: USA: First Nationwide completes financing for Cal Fed.
newsitem.headline: First Nationwide completes financing for Cal Fed.

text.p: First Nationwide Holdings Inc said it completed financing for its planned acquisition of California Federal Bancorp Inc.
In July, the companies announced a merger agreement worth $1.2 billion.

Pending approval by regulators and Cal Fed shareholders, the transaction is expected to close early in 1997. First Nationwide Bank will change its name to California Federal Bank upon completion of the merger of the two institutions.

First Nationwide Holdings is financing the acquisition through issuance of $575 million aggregate principal amount of senior subordinated notes priced at 10.625 percent, due in 2003, a contribution by an indirect parent corporation of First Nationwide Holdings of about $145 million in cash in exchange for $150 million aggregate liquidation value of perpetual preferred stock of First Nationwide Holdings, and existing cash.
